body:
Hey guys!

I have a problem with my Minecraft Forge...

It won't start, all versions of minecraft like 1.6, 1.7 etc will close instantly with those error messages:

[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [LaunchWrapper]: Loading tweak class name cpw.mods.fml.common.launcher.FMLTweaker[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [LaunchWrapper]: Using primary tweak class name cpw.mods.fml.common.launcher.FMLTweaker[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [LaunchWrapper]: Calling tweak class cpw.mods.fml.common.launcher.FMLTweaker[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [FML]: Forge Mod Loader version 7.2.125.1032 for Minecraft 1.7.2 loading[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [FML]: Java is Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM, version 1.8.0_25, running on Windows 8.1:amd64:6.3, installed at C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.8.0_25[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [LaunchWrapper]: Loading tweak class name cpw.mods.fml.common.launcher.FMLInjectionAndSortingTweaker[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [LaunchWrapper]: Loading tweak class name cpw.mods.fml.common.launcher.FMLDeobfTweaker[22:19:09] [main/INFO] [LaunchWrapper]: Calling tweak class cpw.mods.fml.common.launcher.FMLInjectionAndSortingTweaker[22:19:09] [main/ERROR] [LaunchWrapper]: Unable to launchjava.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.ArrayList$Itr.checkForComodification(Unknown Source) ~[?:1.8.0_25] at java.util.ArrayList$Itr.remove(Unknown Source) ~[?:1.8.0_25] at net.minecraft.launchwrapper.Launch.launch(Launch.java:117) [launchwrapper-1.9.jar:?] at net.minecraft.launchwrapper.Launch.main(Launch.java:28) [launchwrapper-1.9.jar:?]Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: Using incremental CMS is deprecated and will likely be removed in a future release

Does someone have an idea how to fix it, or do you have to same error?
I use 64 bit 1.8.0 java version but this is not important... (I tried other versions....)
My minecraft forge stopped launching since months... And ye, I tried re-installing .minecraft but it didn't help too. :C


Help meee!!!!!

kthxbai
-Atdit

title: [FIXED by vsplesk] Forge won't start

replies.body:
This happened to me a while ago.

Solution: Bought a laptop. :D
replies.body_tagged:
This happened to me a while ago.

Solution: Bought a laptop. :D

replies.body:
Not to be mean but this is what you get for Showing off and being rude to others...

But to fix this:
Probably try to downgrade java to 1.7.0_65 Ik a lot of people sometimes have trouble with java 1.8 ._.
